property.name: text
property.value: This model transformation demo shows how one can incorporate test configurations into a model desin. The tasks and arrows represent a typical workflow with regression testing. Run this model and observe its (deterministic) output. It is not enough to check the output alone to assert the model's behavior, because errors can occur without causing noticeable effect.

property.value:

property.value: <?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?> <!DOCTYPE entity PUBLIC "-//UC Berkeley//DTD MoML 1//EN" "http://ptolemy.eecs.berkeley.edu/xml/dtd/MoML_1.dtd"> <entity name="" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.ToplevelTransformer"> <property name="_createdBy" class="ptolemy.kernel.attributes.VersionAttribute" value="7.1.devel"> </property> <property name="SDF Director" class="ptolemy.domains.sdf.kernel.SDFDirector"> <property name="_location" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.Location" value="[75.0, 55.0]"> </property> </property> <port name="input" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.ToplevelTransformer$TransformerPort"> <property name="input"/> <property name="_location" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.Location" value="{20.0, 200.0}"> </property> </port> <port name="output" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.ToplevelTransformer$TransformerPort"> <property name="output"/> <property name="_location" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.Location" value="{580.0, 200.0}"> </property> </port> <entity name="TransformationRule" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.TransformationRule"> <property name="repeatUntilFixpoint" class="ptolemy.data.expr.Parameter" value="true"> </property> <property name="_location" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.Location" value="[260.0, 200.0]"> </property> <entity name="Pattern" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.Pattern"> <property name="Constraint" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.Constraint"> <property name="constraint" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.GTParameter" value="A.getName().startsWith("_")"> </property> <property name="_icon" class="ptolemy.vergil.icon.ValueIcon"> <property name="_color" class="ptolemy.actor.gui.ColorAttribute" value="{0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0}"> </property> </property> <property name="_smallIconDescription" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.SingletonConfigurableAttribute"> <configure> <svg> <text style="font-size:14; font-family:SansSerif; fill:blue">-C-</text> </svg> </configure> </property> <property name="_location" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.Location" value="{155, 190}"> </property> </property> <entity name="A" class="ptolemy.actor.gt.AtomicActorMatcher"> <property name="_location" class="ptolemy.kernel.util.Location" value="[195.0, 65.0]"> </property> </entity> </entity> </entity> <relation name="relation" class="ptolemy.actor.TypedIORelation"> <property name="width" class="ptolemy.data.expr.Parameter" value="1"> </property> </relation> <relation name="relation2" class="ptolemy.actor.TypedIORelation"> <property name="width" class="ptolemy.data.expr.Parameter" value="1"> </property> </relation> <link port="input" relation="relation"/> <link port="output" relation="relation2"/> <link port="TransformationRule.modelInput" relation="relation"/> <link port="TransformationRule.modelOutput" relation="relation2"/> </entity>

property.name: text
property.value: The test workflow is as follows: 1) Double click on the CreateLog transformation, and run it. A bunch of actors will be created. Close the window for the CreateLog transformation, and then run this model to record the signal on every channel in the Log parameter. 2) Open CleanUp and run it to remove the logging actors, but leave the Log parameter updated. 3) Run CreateTest, and then run this model to perform a regression test. If you do not see an error message (which you shouldn't see), it means the test has been passed.

svg.text: Author: Thomas Huining Feng (Inspired by Thomas Mandl)

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

entity.name: Ramp2
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value
